Emailing you now. We care deeply about making our world better. 100% of beef sold in our UK stores is from UK & Ireland. A small portion of chicken served here is from Brazil - not from the areas impacted. Here to listen, learn & make progress. Hoping to discuss soon.

# BKMeltdown  is here!

As of tomorrow we'll be removing plastic toys from our junior meals across the UK. We are melting down plastic toys for good! pic.twitter.com/mW3R0lSl1d

Just bring in your unwanted plastic toys to our restaurants and we'll recycle them into new ways to play! Show your toy at the counter between 19th September and the 30th September and youâ€™ll get a free King Junior meal! #Meltdown  #BKMeltdown

Hey Neil, the toys we accept are: any given with a King Junior meal or similar free meal toys from other restaurants as well as free giveaway toys from confectionary items such as those included in cereal boxes or magazines.

Beep beep! As of today we're removing plastic toys from junior meals across the UK. And if you bring in any single use plastic toy, weâ€™ll recycle it and youâ€™ll get a free King Junior meal! Join the #BKMeltdown  #Meltdown    https:// bit.ly/2mhWJRp Â  pic.twitter.com/412BMrCskn
Check out the T&Cs here: https:// bit.ly/2kpgfuR Â

Hey, the toys we accept are: any given with a King Junior meal or similar free meal toys from other restaurants as well as free giveaway toys from confectionary items such as those included in cereal boxes or magazines.

The toys are transformed into play areas and special trays! This means we are not only eradicating single-use plastic toys from our business, but we are also replacing any new plastics that would have been purchased for the trays & play areas.
Dear @McDonaldsUK  welcome to the #Meltdown  - good to have you on board! If you need help getting rid of your plastic toys - you know where we are! (Weâ€™ll even give you a free meal to say thanks!)

In 2018, we worked with our supplier to reduce the amount of plastic we use in our straws. As a result nearly 30 tonnes of plastic has been removed from the straws and we're working towards our 2025 goal of making sure our packaging is 100% reusable, recyclable or compostable!
We'll take theirs too!
